Package tools.concurrent

Class SchedulerSet<S extends Scheduler>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.concurrent.Scheduler
      • tools.concurrent.SchedulerSet<S>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObsInterface<Scheduler,​SchedulerEventObject>
    public class SchedulerSet<S extends Scheduler>
extends Scheduler
    This class provides a fair time-wise distribution over multiple schedulers.
    To do so, it gives tasks to any scheduler which doesn't have a task yet. If none available, then it queue's the task and schedules the task for the first scheduler which comes available.
    Has support for easy scheduler creation using reflection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SchedulerSet

        public SchedulerSet​(java.lang.Class<S> clazz,
                    int amt)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a scheduler set with amt schedulers of type clazz.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the schedulers to create.
        amt - The amount of schedulers to create.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If some exception occured during the creation of the schedulers, or if the amount is less or equal to 0.
        See Also:
        SchedulerSet(Class, int, Class[], Object[])

      • SchedulerSet

        public SchedulerSet​(java.lang.Class<S> clazz,
                    int amt,
                    java.lang.Class<?>[] types,
                    java.lang.Object[] args)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a scheduler set with amt schedulers of type clazz. Uses the constructor specified by types and uses the arguments args to create the schedulers.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the schedulers to create.
        amt - The amount of schedulers to create. Must be at least 1.
        types - The type values of the constructor to use.
        args - The arguments to use in the constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If some exception occured during the creation of the schedulers, or if the amount is less or equal to 0.

      • SchedulerSet

        public SchedulerSet​(S... schedulers)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a scheduler set of the given schedulers.
        Parameters:
        schedulers - The schedulers for this scheduler set. All elements must be non-null. Must have a length of at least 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the length of the array is 0.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided array or one of its elements is null.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Starts the scheduler. This function only returns when the scheduler is started. This does mean that all initial configurations are done (i.e. tasks will be queued), but this does not mean that the first task will be processed directly.
        Specified by:
        start in class Scheduler
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the scheduler was already started or terminated, or could not be started.
        See Also:
        Scheduler.terminate(), Scheduler.isStarted()

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Terminates the scheduler. After this call, no new tasks can be scheduled with this scheduler. A new instance has to be created to schedule new tasks. The scheduler will only finish tasks it already started, but not tasks which were added to the queue but not yet started.

        Blocks until the scheduler has terminated completely.
        Overrides:
        terminate in class Scheduler
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        Scheduler.terminate(long, TimeUnit), Scheduler.forceTerminate(), Scheduler.isTerminated()

      • terminate

        public boolean terminate​(long timeout,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit tu)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Terminates the scheduler.
        After this call, no new tasks can be scheduled with this scheduler, even if the call results in false. A new instance has to be created to schedule new tasks. The scheduler will only finish tasks it already started, but not tasks which were added to the queue but not yet started.

        Blocks until either the scheduler has terminated completely or the timeout has passed.
        Specified by:
        terminate in class Scheduler
        Parameters:
        timeout - The time to wait at most before returning.
        tu - The time unit of timeout.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler is terminated. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted.
        See Also:
        Scheduler.terminate(), Scheduler.forceTerminate(), Scheduler.isTerminated()

      • forceTerminate

        public void forceTerminate()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Forcefully terminates the scheduler. If a task is being executed, then it will be interrupted.

        Blocks until the scheduler has terminated completely.
        Overrides:
        forceTerminate in class Scheduler
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted.
        See Also:
        Scheduler.terminate(), Scheduler.terminate(long, TimeUnit), Scheduler.isTerminated()

      • tryTerminate

        public boolean tryTerminate()
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Tries to terminate the scheduler without waiting. If this is not possible, then the termination process will be invoked, but not on the current thread.
        Overrides:
        tryTerminate in class Scheduler
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler could be terminated without waiting. false otherwise.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Checks whether the scheduler has no more tasks left.
        Specified by:
        isDone in class Scheduler
        Returns:

      • waitUntilDone

        public void waitUntilDone()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Waits until the entire queue is empty. This function will also return when the scheduler is terminated.
        Specified by:
        waitUntilDone in class Scheduler
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted.
